name: Tension headaches
description: Tension headaches are the most common type of headache. They often feel like a tight band around the forehead and are usually caused by muscle tension in the neck and scalp.
how_it_happens: Often caused by muscle tension in the neck and scalp.
where_it_happens: Across the forehead, temples, and back of the head.
effects: Dull, aching pain; sensitivity to light or sound.
symptoms: Pressure or tightness around the head; mild to moderate pain.

name: Neck strain or spasms
description: Neck strain or spasms occur when the neck muscles are overstretched or torn. It can result from sudden movements or prolonged poor posture, leading to pain and stiffness in the neck.
how_it_happens: Overstretching or tearing of neck muscles.
symptoms: Pain, muscle tightness, difficulty moving neck.

name: Temporomandibular joint (TMJ) pain
description: TMJ pain involves the temporomandibular joint, which connects the jaw to the skull. It can cause jaw pain, difficulty chewing, and clicking or popping sounds when moving the jaw.
how_it_happens: Injury to the jaw, joint misalignment, or muscle tension.
effects: Difficulty chewing, clicking or popping sound, lockjaw.

name: Rotator cuff injury
description: A rotator cuff injury involves damage to the muscles and tendons that stabilize the shoulder joint. It can result from overuse, aging, or acute trauma, causing pain and weakness in the shoulder.
how_it_happens: Overuse, aging, or acute trauma.

name: Shoulder impingement
description: Shoulder impingement occurs when the shoulder blade puts pressure on the rotator cuff tendons, causing inflammation and pain when lifting the arm or reaching overhead.
how_it_happens: Shoulder blade puts pressure on the rotator cuff.

name: Frozen shoulder
description: Frozen shoulder, or adhesive capsulitis, is a condition characterized by stiffness and reduced mobility in the shoulder joint. It develops gradually and can be quite painful, limiting daily activities.
how_it_happens: Stiffening of the shoulder capsule.

name: Muscle strains or sprains
description: Muscle strains or sprains in the back involve overstretched or torn muscles or ligaments. They can result from lifting heavy objects, sudden movements, or poor posture, causing pain and inflammation.
how_it_happens: Lifting heavy objects, sudden movements.

name: Herniated disc
description: A herniated disc occurs when the soft inner core of a spinal disc protrudes through the outer layer. This can irritate nearby nerves, leading to pain, numbness, or weakness in the back or legs.
how_it_happens: Wear and tear, lifting, twisting.

name: Sciatica
description: Sciatica is characterized by pain that radiates from the lower back down one or both legs, following the path of the sciatic nerve. It's often caused by compression or irritation of the nerve roots in the lumbar spine.
how_it_happens: Compression of the sciatic nerve.
where_it_happens: Lower back, radiating down the leg.

name: Tennis elbow (lateral epicondylitis)
description: Tennis elbow is a condition that involves inflammation of the tendons on the outside of the elbow. It's commonly caused by repetitive wrist or forearm movements, resulting in pain and weakness in the elbow and forearm.
how_it_happens: Overuse of forearm muscles.

name: Golfer's elbow (medial epicondylitis)
description: Golfer's elbow is similar to tennis elbow but affects the tendons on the inside of the elbow. It's often caused by repetitive wrist or finger motions, leading to pain and stiffness in the elbow and forearm.
how_it_happens: Repetitive wrist or finger motions.

name: Bicep or tricep strains
description: Strains in the bicep or tricep muscles involve overstretching or tearing of the muscle fibers. They can result from sudden movements or overuse, causing pain, swelling, and weakness in the upper arm.
how_it_happens: Overuse, sudden movements.

name: Costochondritis
description: Costochondritis is inflammation of the cartilage that connects the ribs to the sternum (breastbone). It can cause chest pain that may mimic a heart attack, but it's generally harmless and improves with rest and anti-inflammatory medications.
how_it_happens: Inflammation of the cartilage connecting ribs to sternum.
symptoms: Chest pain, often mistaken for heart attack.

name: Abdominal muscle strain
description: An abdominal muscle strain involves overstretching or tearing of the abdominal muscles. It can result from sudden movements or overexertion, causing pain and tenderness in the abdomen.
how_it_happens: Overstretching or tearing of abdominal muscles.

name: Diaphragm strain
description: A diaphragm strain occurs when the diaphragm muscle is overstretched or torn. It can cause difficulty breathing and pain in the chest or upper abdomen, often resulting from sudden exertion or trauma.
how_it_happens: Overstretching or tearing of the diaphragm muscle.
symptoms: Difficulty breathing, chest or upper abdominal pain.

name: Hip flexor strain
description: A hip flexor strain involves overstretching or tearing of the hip flexor muscles. It can result from sudden movements or overuse, causing pain and stiffness in the front of the hip or groin area.
how_it_happens: Overstretching or tearing of hip flexor muscles.
where_it_happens: Front of the hip or groin area.
symptoms: Pain, stiffness in front of hip or groin.

name: Piriformis syndrome
description: Piriformis syndrome is a condition where the piriformis muscle irritates the sciatic nerve, causing pain, tingling, or numbness in the buttocks and down the leg.
how_it_happens: Irritation of the sciatic nerve by the piriformis muscle.
symptoms: Buttock pain, leg pain, tingling or numbness.

name: Trochanteric bursitis
description: Trochanteric bursitis is inflammation of the bursa located near the greater trochanter of the femur. It can cause pain and tenderness on the outside of the hip, often exacerbated by walking or climbing stairs.
how_it_happens: Inflammation of the bursa near the greater trochanter of the femur.
symptoms: Hip pain, worsened by walking or climbing stairs.

name: ACL injury
description: An ACL (anterior cruciate ligament) injury involves tearing of the ACL in the knee. It's often caused by sudden stops or changes in direction, resulting in pain, swelling, and instability in the knee.
how_it_happens: Tearing of the ACL in the knee.

name: Hamstring strain
description: A hamstring strain involves overstretching or tearing of the hamstring muscles at the back of the thigh. It can result from sudden movements or overuse, causing pain, swelling, and weakness in the hamstring.
how_it_happens: Overstretching or tearing of hamstring muscles.

name: Quadriceps strain
description: A quadriceps strain involves overstretching or tearing of the quadriceps muscles at the front of the thigh. It can result from sudden movements or overuse, causing pain, swelling, and weakness in the quadriceps.
how_it_happens: Overstretching or tearing of quadriceps muscles.

name: Calf muscle strain
description: A calf muscle strain involves overstretching or tearing of the calf muscles. It can result from sudden movements or overuse, causing pain, swelling, and difficulty walking.
how_it_happens: Overstretching or tearing of calf muscles.

name: Shin splints
description: Shin splints are a common exercise-related problem caused by inflammation of the muscles, tendons, and bone tissue around the shinbone. They result from overuse or improper training techniques, causing pain along the inner edge of the shinbone.
how_it_happens: Inflammation of muscles, tendons, and bone tissue around the shinbone.
symptoms: Pain along the inner edge of the shinbone.

name: IT band syndrome
description: IT band syndrome involves inflammation and pain in the IT (iliotibial) band, a thick band of tissue that runs from the hip to the knee. It's often caused by friction of the IT band against the knee during activities like running or cycling, leading to pain on the outside of the knee or thigh.
how_it_happens: Inflammation and pain in the IT band.
where_it_happens: Outside of the knee or thigh.
symptoms: Pain on the outside of the knee or thigh.
